text: hamas exercises undisputed authority
within Gaza and amnesties powerful
report depicts an organization
responding to the relentless pressure of
Israeli military operations with a
brutal campaign against its own enemies
within the report says that at least 23
Palestinians were subjected to what it
calls extrajudicial execution while
dozens more were arrested and tortured
including members of Hamas as political
rivals in the Fatah movement Hamas
accused its victims of collaboration
with Israel but the report says that
most of those killed were already in
prison when the summer conflict broke
out and several were executed before
their trials were finished in one
shocking incident six men were shot dead
outside a mosque as they were forced to
kneel in hoods in front of a crowd of
men women and children the amnesty
report accuses her mass of calling for
Rights and justice for Palestinians were
not always acting in a manner that
reflects respect for those ideals the
organizations calling it Hamas to
cooperate with any international inquiry
into such violations and to bring
perpetrators to justice Kevin Connolly
BBC News Jerusalem
